summary: Fix hero section layout shifts during typing animation by implementing consistent height constraints and optimizing text container dimensions to accommodate all phrase lengths across viewport sizes.

action_plan.description: Measure and calculate the exact height requirements for the longest phrase ('Machine Learning Researcher') across all viewport sizes and font scaling
Update .hero-title min-height values to accommodate the longest phrase on both desktop (increase from 6rem) and mobile (increase from 4rem) breakpoints
Add CSS properties to prevent text wrapping and ensure consistent line-height behavior during text transitions
Implement white-space: nowrap and overflow handling for the typing text container to prevent multi-line text issues
Add CSS containment properties to isolate the typing animation from affecting surrounding layout
Test the typing animation across different viewport sizes to ensure no layout shifts occur during phrase transitions
Optimize the typing animation timing to ensure smooth transitions without visible height changes

risks: Increasing min-height too much could create excessive white space on shorter phrases
Mobile viewport constraints might require different approach than desktop
Font scaling (clamp function) could affect height calculations across viewport sizes
Changes might affect other hero section elements positioning
dependencies: CSS clamp() function behavior across browsers
issue_title: Bug: Hero section moves up and down when typing animation changes text length
